nodes.text: A campaign occurred on Zaloriis sometime during the Galactic Empire's reign over the galaxy, which began in 19 BBY, and prior to the Battle of Hoth in 3 ABY. The conflict involved the Empire and the Zalorians, the inhabitants of Zaloriis, and came about in response to a revolt there. The human male Maximilian Veers participated in the campaign on behalf of the Empire, where demonstrated his courage and cunning, and utilized several new tactics of his own design. Veers won the campaign for the Empire. His attributes led to his eventual promotion to the rank of general in the Imperial Army, and attracted the attention of the Sith Lord Darth Vader, who requested that Veers be added to his personal Death Squadron.

The conflict on Zaloriis was given an indirect mention in canon in Adam Gidwitz's 2015 children's book So You Want to Be a Jedi?, a retelling of the 1980 film Star Wars: Episode V The Empire Strikes Back. The conflict was identified as a campaign in Star Wars: The Galactic Explorer's Guide, a 2019 reference book by Jason Fry.

The battle had originally appeared in the Star Wars Legends continuity in the 2001 LucasArts video game Star Wars: Galactic Battlegrounds. Within the game, the fourth level of the Galactic Empire campaign occurs on the planet Zaloriis, where the player controls the Imperial Army and must defeat the Rebel Alliance. At the end of the level, Maximilian Veers receives his promotion from colonel to general.
